metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10168 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in gd_io.c in the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.4 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving the number of horizontal and vertical chunks in an image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.6
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.6').
